page.title: 14Laughton-Peoples' Views, 2
page.content: Then one of the people said that newcomers were snobbish. When we got back to school we talked about why some people thought that newcomers were snobbish. We decided that people who came into our area from outside mostly had the best houses so they probably have better jobs and more money than those people who have lived in the village all their lives. So we think that jealousy has something to do with it. We also thought that people who have always lived here do not want the area to change. Most people said that newcomers were alright. One lady said that the majority of newcomers work all day so she never met them. We went to one door and a woman said "I don't want to be on a computer", but her husband said he would try to help us. Some people would not even answer the door.
